What is the purpose of the fee pool in the Verus ecosystem?

The fee pool is a collection of all fees generated by the Verus protocol. With each new block, 1% of the fee pool is added to the block rewards, making mining and staking in the Verus ecosystem a potentially profitable and competitive endeavor.

## Fee Pool
All the fees generated by the protocol are collected in the ``fee pool``. With each new block, ``1%`` of the fee pool is added on top of the block rewards. It is expected that fees outnumber block rewards, making mining and staking in the Verus ecosystem a profitable and competitive endeavor.
How does the fee pool impact the profitability of mining and staking in Verus?

The fee pool is designed to make mining and staking in Verus more profitable. By adding 1% of the fee pool to the block rewards with each new block, the protocol incentivizes miners and stakers to participate in the network, as fees are expected to outnumber block rewards.

## Fee Pool
All the fees generated by the protocol are collected in the ``fee pool``. With each new block, ``1%`` of the fee pool is added on top of the block rewards. It is expected that fees outnumber block rewards, making mining and staking in the Verus ecosystem a profitable and competitive endeavor.
What is the relationship between fees and block rewards in the Verus ecosystem?

In the Verus ecosystem, fees are expected to outnumber block rewards. The protocol is designed such that the fees collected in the fee pool are added to the block rewards, making the overall reward for miners and stakers more substantial.

## Fee Pool
